text:
Multiple orbital tumors were cavernous hemangiomas.
 Two distinct masses in the left orbit were incidentally found in a 48-year-old woman during a computed tomographic scan done to evaluate neurologic complaints.
 Initial diagnostic considerations focused on a lymphoproliferative disorder or other systemic disease.
 Orbitotomy revealed two discrete tumors, both cavernous hemangiomas.
 Although uncommon, cavernous hemangioma should be considered in the differential diagnosis of the patient with multiple orbital lesions.
